bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, January 21, 1938

div1.p: Hutchison suggests Paul de Kruif as an alternative speaker for the Lazear celebration if Lord Dawson is not available.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, January 21, 1938
div1.opener:
Hutchison
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
January 21, 1938
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
In case Lord Dawson does not accept
for Commencement, do you think of any American
distinguished in medicine who would be a great
Commencement speaker and who has not received too
many honorary degrees, and who might take his
place? It occurs to me that we might get Paul
de Kruif who collaborated with Howard on the
writing of “Yellow Jack.” I am not sure that we
will want to follow out this medical plan for this
Commencement if Lord Dawson does not come because
of the expense, but while thinking this over I
thought I had better write you and ask if you
thought of any ace speaker along medical lines who
would be a good one to fit into a Lazear celebration?

Harriet is improving and we are all
pushing along in good shape. Give our love to Mary
and to the family. I would like to see them all
and hope to do so one of these days.
div1.closer:
Affectionately yours, Hutch Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
